intro: Hieracium lobophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium lobophyllum is often found in rocky or gravelly areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
